question: When was vivotif first licenced in Europe?
ideal_answer: The vaccine vivotif was first licensed in Europe in 1983.

snippets.text: Vivotif® is an oral live attenuated vaccine which contains a mutated strain of Salmonella (Ty21a) and reproduces the natural infection. The vaccine was first licensed in Europe in 1983 and in the US in 1989, and over the years it has proved efficacious and safe.
